sense.name: a twist or turn in a form or object
sense.examples: The diagram shows the bends in the tertiary structure of the organic molecule. This plastic tubing got a bend in it from lying in the sun too long. It will be difficult to straighten out the bends in this metal sheeting.

sense.name: the act of moving, turning something
sense.examples: With a bend of her knees, she curtsied to the queen. The bend of the tree boughs in the wind brought down a lot of leaves. The artist's bend of a piece of wire into the shape of a rabbit amused the children.

sense.name: a curve in a road, river or other passageway
sense.examples: The gas station should be just around the next bend. The village was established along a bend in the river. THe train derailed when it took the bend too fast.

sense.name: a traversing diagonal on a heraldic shield
sense.examples: The noble family's shield has a crimson bend across it.

sense.name: a type of knot that ties ropes or lines together
sense.examples: Our sailing instructor showed us how to make a sheet bend. Can you tie a carrick bend?

sense.name: decompression sickness
sense.examples: The diver got the bends from staying at depth too long. He got the bends from ascending too rapidly on a 120-foot dive.
